title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 07 June 2013 - XWiki
content:
<polx> has quit  
00:30 <vmassol> has quit  
00:37 <chalx\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
00:37 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
00:37 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
00:38 <chalx\_> has quit  
01:39 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
01:40 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
02:36 <chalx\_\_> has quit  
03:43 <Denis> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
06:29 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
07:37 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:56 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:28 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:30 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:55 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
08:59 <\_BuBU1> has left #xwiki  
09:00 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
09:09 <vmassol> good morning everyone  
09:10 <vmassol> we're getting closer to the 5.1M2 release (Monday)  
09:10 <vmassol> we really need to fix the build today so that we're ready  
09:11 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:11 <vmassol> I can't believe we're letting 15 jobs fail :)  
09:12 <vmassol> tmortagne: we need to fix http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise/10231/consoleText  
09:12 <vmassol> might be your update of solr as you said  
09:12 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes  
09:12 <tmortagne> was planning to look at it today  
09:12 <vmassol> ok  
09:13 <vmassol> wow  
09:13 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform%20Quality%20Checks/  
09:13 <vmassol> all yellow flags  
09:13 <vmassol> restartng agent9  
09:14 <vmassol> this is weird too: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/3959/consoleText  
09:14 <vmassol> looks like some jenkins issue  
09:15 <vmassol> h no  
09:15 <vmassol> ah no  
09:15 <vmassol> just a timeot  
09:15 <vmassol> hmm  
09:15 <vmassol> Build timed out (after 15 minutes). Marking the build as aborted.  
09:15 <vmassol> just after:  
09:15 <vmassol> [INFO] Import XAR dependencies using user [superadmin]...  
09:15 <vmassol> 2013-06-06 19:36:56,970 [pool-1-thread-1] WARN  o.x.e.i.StandardEnvironment    - No permanent directory configured. Using temporary directory [/tmp].  
09:15 <vmassol> seems we have some issue  
09:16 <vmassol> let's see what happens for the current build  
09:20 <vmassol> success: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/  
09:20 <vmassol> :)  
09:20 <vmassol> still seems we have issue looking at the history  
09:20 <vmassol> since the 6th of june  
09:20 <vmassol> one build out of two times out  
09:20 <tmortagne> solr 4.3 triggers restlet 2.1.1 dependency given the issues we have with XCOMMONS-341 looks like I will have to revert th upgrade  
09:21 <vmassol> indeed  
09:21 <tmortagne> I supposed the upgraded for a reason  
09:21 <tmortagne> but this mean we really need to find a solution  
09:21 <tmortagne> for restlet  
09:22 <vmassol> yes  
09:22 <tmortagne> blocking upgrade to two import features  
09:22 <vmassol> I can ping them  
09:24 <vmassol> tmortagne: is that the only issue?  
09:25 <tmortagne> vmassol: no idea  
09:25 <tmortagne> that's one issue that making our existing test fail  
09:25 <tmortagne> did not tested more  
09:27 <vmassol> mail sent  
09:30 <tmortagne> the bug with [ already existed AFAIK (which is already a nonsense) but they made it even worst in 2.1.1 (it used to produce String URL with non encoded [ while it now produce an exception)  
09:31 <tmortagne> I reported the encoding issue with [ is several ways and they don't care I really don't understand, it makes the UriBuilder pretty unusable (we only use it in tests)  
09:32 <vmassol> you could reply to my mail with the other links if you wish tmortagne  
09:32 <vmassol> (if you think it helps)  
09:42 <tmortagne> vmassol: not much to add, I was hopping that it was obvious that the example I gave is something you cannot keep broken but look like they don't care about proper support of URLs...  
09:42 <vmassol> let's see what he answers  
09:47 <vmassol> tmortagne: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/3961/console  
10:18 <vmassol> tmortagne: you have a lock on it, normal? (I'd like to add a warning that it requires PR)  
10:18 <tmortagne> vmassol: you should not have it anymore  
10:18 <vmassol> hmm actually maybe not  
10:19 <vmassol> need to check if we require PR for selects  
10:19 <tmortagne> we do  
10:19 <tmortagne> otherwise anyone you access anything  
10:20 <vmassol> indeed  
10:20 <vmassol>         if (!isShortFormStatement(query.getStatement()) && !getBridge().hasProgrammingRights()) {  
10:20 <vmassol>             throw new QueryException("Full form statements requires programming right", query, null);  
10:30 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:44 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:44 <vmassol> evalica: "Over 450 extensions: applications, macros, skins, plugins, snippets, etc." maybe we should change it to "Over 600 extensions…" ;)  
10:46 <vmassol> :)  
11:09 <vmassol> ok we now have "only" the func tests to fix on ci  
11:09 <vmassol> lots of 5.0.x failure for a stable branch  
11:10 <vmassol> strange error: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-manager-test-selenium-5.0.x/36/console  
11:23 <chalx> vmassol, all dependencies scope must be runtime ?  
11:23 <vmassol> chalx: it depends, if they're needed at runtime then yes, if they're needed at compile time then they need to be compile, see http://maven.apache.org/guides/introduction/introduction-to-dependency-mechanism.html  
11:23 <vmassol> again check that link to see what "provided" means  
11:23 <chalx> vmassol, thx  
11:24 <vmassol> if you say provided  
11:24 <vmassol> and that dep is not there  
11:24 <vmassol> not there  = not installed  
11:24 <vmassol> then your extension will fail when it exeecutes obviously  
11:24 <vmassol> (chalx)  
11:24 <vmassol> go it?  
11:24 <chalx> yes  
11:24 <vmassol> if you say "runtime" then the EM will install the required deps  
11:32 <chalx> vmassol, if i fixed a bug I should say in commit which bug i fix?  
11:32 <vmassol> chalx: oh yes  
11:32 <vmassol> see  
11:33 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentPractices#HRule:AlwaysputaJIRAissuereferenceincommitmessages  
11:49 <sburjan> vmassol: this latest merge is part of the new core ?  
12:01 <sburjan> has quit  
12:03 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
12:09 <evalica> I've added a Form me on Github ribbon on devs.xwiki.org http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome let me know if it's ok or we should remove it  
12:09 <evalica> \*fork  
12:12 <vmassol> evalica: looks good for dev.xwiki.org, I'm not sure I'd put on other subwikis though  
12:13 <evalica> I agree  
12:26 <tmortagne> evalica: vey nice  
12:26 <tmortagne> vmassol: I would not mind having the same on on each top level project wiki  
12:27 <tmortagne> for the home page maybe the best is to add a new page to the slider talking about git repositories  
12:27 <vmassol> has quit  
12:27 <tmortagne> main wiki home page I mean  
12:46 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:48 <sburjan> evalica: I wouldn't use black colour, it's like we're mourning or something  
12:49 <evalica> sburjan: well these are the colors https://github.com/blog/273-github-ribbons - all others grab attention from the content to the ribbon. You can experiment with the colors and see if there is another that match better the devs.xwiki.org colortheme  
12:49 <evalica> sburjan: and is not black, is darkblue  
12:49 <vmassol> the color is very good IMO  
12:49 <vmassol> sburjan: you have anything against black now?  
12:49 <vmassol> :)  
12:49 <vmassol> are you constantly mourning?  
12:50 <vmassol> :)  
12:52 <vmassol> more seriously the point is not to draw too much attention  
12:52 <vmassol> it shouldn't detract from the main content  
12:59 <vmassol> FTR yet another component dependency injection fwk: http://restx.io/docs/ref-factory.html ;)  
12:59 <mflorea> has quit  
13:16 <sburjan> vmassol: my point is that it looks like a ribbon which you put when someone dies. And it's not me who is mourning, it's the whole community :)  
13:17 <sburjan> I would have gone the gray one  
13:50 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:07 <chalx> has quit  
14:23 <tmortagne> has quit  
14:23 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
14:43 <evalica> has quit  
14:43 <vmassol> sburjan: you should document several versions on e.x.o, just document the latest and describe changes in the release notes section  
14:43 <sburjan> vmassol, this is what I am doing now :)  
14:43 <vmassol> cool  
14:43 <vmassol> btw you're missing compatbiility section too  
14:51 <sburjan> vmassol: done  
14:53 <vmassol> btw sburjan  
14:53 <vmassol> your pom.xml is not correct  
14:53 <vmassol> on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Test+Reporting+Application I don't see any dependencies which is impossible  
14:54 <vmassol> for ex you're not using any velocity macro, any include, any message macro, etc?  
14:54 <vmassol> what it means in practice is that you don't have any functional test for it...  
14:54 <vmassol> as otherwise you'd have found them  
14:54 <vmassol> ....  
14:54 <sburjan> I have 3 dependencies in my pom  
14:54 <vmassol> not in 2.0  
14:55 <sburjan> only in 2.0  
14:55 <vmassol> then you didn't import the extension  
14:55 <vmassol> why not?  
14:55 <sburjan> https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-testreporting/blob/master/pom.xml  
14:55 <vmassol> here's an example fyi: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/IRC+Bot+Application#HDependencies  
14:55 <vmassol> this is 2.1 not 2.0  
14:55 <vmassol> in any case I'm sure you're missing \*a lot\* of deps  
14:55 <vmassol> actually  
14:56 <vmassol> you may be lucky if the deps you include also use them  
14:56 <vmassol> that's luck ;)  
14:56 <sburjan> I don't know why my 3 dependencies don't show up there. I can tell you for sure I had them in my pom.xml \_before\_ releasing  
14:56 <vmassol> you don't have any func test to remove the luck  
14:57 <sburjan> maybe they are not there because Auto Update property was unchecked until 10 minutes ago  
14:57 <vmassol> when you import  
14:57 <vmassol> the deps are added  
14:59 <sburjan> how do I do that ? I manually added a new obhect of type ExtensionCode.ExtensionVersionClass  
15:00 <sburjan> do we have instructions for these steps anywhere ?  
15:02 <vmassol> sburjan: you mean for adding a func test?  
15:02 <sburjan> vmassol: no, for "<vmassol> when you import"  
15:02 <sburjan> what import ?  
15:02 <vmassol> extension import  
15:02 <vmassol> on exo  
15:03 <vmassol> donc is here: http://contrib.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome  
15:03 <vmassol> \*doc  
15:03 <sburjan> ah ok  
15:03 <sburjan> importing now  
15:03 <vmassol> you never imported?  
15:04 <vmassol> no  
15:04 <vmassol> auto import  
15:04 <sburjan> only the first time. But I was thinking that is only for the first time.. when you add the extensions, not for next versions also  
15:04 <vmassol> is just for the scheduler job  
15:04 <vmassol> (every day)  
15:04 <vmassol> anyway try importing  
15:04 <sburjan> then I either import manually now, or I wait a day :)  
15:04 <sburjan> ok  
15:05 <sburjan> done :)  
15:05 <vmassol> worked, see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Test+Reporting+Application?viewer=changes&rev2=13.4  
15:05 <tmortagne> the sheduler job is not enabled, it started at each release right now  
15:05 <tmortagne> s/sheduler/scheduler/  
15:05 <vmassol> indeed  
15:06 <sburjan> didn't know  
15:08 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:09 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:10 <tmortagne> sburjan: something I did not followed, you imported the version 1.0 et added the 2.0 by hand ?  
15:13 <sburjan> tmortagne: yes  
15:13 <tmortagne> sburjan: why ?  
15:13 <sburjan> and then I reimported as vmassol said, from extensions WebHome  
15:14 <tmortagne> sburjan: go to your extension page  
15:14 <sburjan> because I didn't know than when adding a new version I have to Import. I imagined import is \_only\_ for the first time you install the application  
15:14 <tmortagne> you see the "Extension imported from repository maven-xwiki" ?  
15:14 <sburjan> yes  
15:14 <sburjan> yes  
15:14 <tmortagne> this button update (reimport) the extension  
15:15 <tmortagne> when it's not done by the scheduler  
15:15 <sburjan> did not know that !  
15:15 <sburjan> I am afraid to work on extensions because I don't want to break something  
15:15 <tmortagne> it's a wiki if you break something you can revert it  
15:16 <sburjan> I think that this is my paranoia kicking in  
15:30 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
15:47 <chalx> has quit  
16:27 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
17:15 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
17:23 <tdelafosse> has quit  
17:26 <jbwiv> vmassol: could you point me at that migration guide link again? Can't seem to find it in my logs  
17:26 <vmassol> migration for what jbwiv?  
17:26 <jbwiv> sorry, for moving from one machine to another. one xwiki server to another  
17:26 <vmassol> !search backup  
17:26 <vmassol> first link  
17:26 <jbwiv> you and I had discussed it weeks ago when I was having problems with images not showing up with postgresql after migration  
17:27 <jbwiv> vmassol: ok, thanks.  
17:38 <sburjan> has quit  
17:53 <jbwiv> has quit
